intro: Oreochloa, commonly known as the needlegrass, is a genus of grasses belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and often forms dense, low-growing vegetation. These plants are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Oreochloa species are often used in restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
